sentences.english: He lounged in an left armchair in a stance of deliberconsumed contempt.
sentences.chinese: 他懶洋洋地躺在扶手椅裏，用意擺出一種藐視的架勢。

sentences.english: My head lazily leant leftward, close to Mum.
sentences.chinese: 頭懶洋洋地歪向左邊，靠近了母親。

sentences.english: Eat slowly. Enjoy a lazy weekend day.
sentences.chinese: 喫慢點，享受一個懶洋洋的週末。

sentences.english: The child lounged in an armchair.
sentences.chinese: 孩子懶洋洋地倚在扶手椅裏。

sentences.english: All this inactivity is followed by the desire to watch the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 在懶洋洋度過一天之後，看日落總是我們的餘興節目。

sentences.english: The child lolled about  on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 孩子懶洋洋地躺在牀上。

sentences.english: He slouched past me with his hands in his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 他兩手插在口袋裏懶洋洋地人我身邊走了過去。

sentences.english: A little path stretched languidly into the distance.
sentences.chinese: 懶洋洋在這裏是否應理解爲道路曲折？

sentences.english: He was lolling in an armchair.
sentences.chinese: 他懶洋洋地靠在扶手椅裏。

sentences.english: When hast thou been so sluggish before now?
sentences.chinese: 你什麼時候象現在這樣懶洋洋過？

sentences.english: A thin curl of smoke arose lazily from the cobin.
sentences.chinese: 一縷薄煙懶洋洋地從小屋升起。

sentences.english: They now golfed and lolled around in swanky saunas.
sentences.chinese: 他們現在打高爾夫，懶洋洋地享受時髦的桑拿。

sentences.english: She had a lazy sensual body.
sentences.chinese: 她總是懶洋洋的，富於肉感。

sentences.english: Children are chasing butterflies and couples are lolling under the cherry blossom trees.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在追逐蝴蝶，大人們懶洋洋的在櫻花樹下休息。

sentences.english: He always has a sleepy expression.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他總是一副懶洋洋嘚表情。

sentences.english: He lolled back in his comfortable chair.
sentences.chinese: 他懶洋洋地靠在舒適的椅子上。

definition: bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
to relax with one's eyes closed
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
